creator.name: Raad van Civiele en Criminele Justitie / Rechtbank / College (Commissarissen) van Kleine Zaken Curaçao
creator.name_english: Council of Civil and Criminal Justice / Court of Justice / Board (Commissioners) for Minor Cases on Curaçao
creator.his_func: During the 17th and 18th centuries Curaçao had only one council, which concerned itself with both government and administration of justice. In 1804 a first step was made to separate the political and judicial administration. Two members of the island's council were commissioned with the affairs of civil and criminal justice, assisted by a secretary. In 1816 a Court of Civil and Criminal Justice was established, consisting of a president and four Councillors, assisted by a secretary. The political government was no longer involved with the administration of justice. According to the government regulation of 1828, the Court of Civil and Criminal Justice consisted of a president and six members, two civil servants, two landowners and two merchants, assisted by a secretary. The Commissioner of Police acted as the Public Prosecutor. In 1834 the Court was dissolved and replaced by a Court of Justice.
